instructions: Turn on 2-Step Verification and choose a second verification step. If you already use 2-Step Verification, go to the next step. On your Android phone, go to myaccount.google.com/security . Under "Signing in to Google," select 2-Step Verification . You might need to sign in. Scroll to Set up alternative second step and tap Add security key . Select your Android phone and then Add . You should see a confirmation that your phone was added as a security key.

Make sure Bluetooth is turned on for both devices. Sign in on the new device: On a computer or Chromebook, sign in to your Google Account using a supported browser, like Chrome. On an iPhone or iPad, sign in to your Google Account using the Smart Lock app . Check your Android phone for a notification. Double-tap the "Are you trying to sign in?" notification. Follow the instructions to confirm it s you signing in.

Image titled Encrypt an Android Phone Step 1 1 Charge your phone or tablet for at least an hour. Encrypting an Android can take an hour or more and it s important not to run out of power during that time. [2] If you don't already lock your Android with a PIN, password, or pattern, you'll need to set one up now. [3] Open the Settings app, tap Security , then tap Screen Lock to set up your locking method . A confirmation message will appear. If prompted, enter your PIN, pattern, or password and tap Continue . Image titled Encrypt an Android Phone Step 5 5 Tap or . It s at the bottom of the screen. Another confirmation message will appear. Encryption is not reversible. The only way to undo this change is to restore your phone or tablet to its factory settings. Image titled Encrypt an Android Phone Step 6 6 Tap or again to confirm. The encryption process will begin immediately. Once the encryption is complete, your phone or tablet will restart.
